dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3726 IH: Fisher House Availability Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Miller-Meeks (for herself and Mrs. Dingell) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to make temporary lodging facilities of the Department of Veterans Affairs available for certain TRICARE beneficiaries on a space-available basis, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fisher House Availability Act of 2025.

section.header: Availability of Department of Veterans Affairs temporary lodging to certain TRICARE beneficiaries
section.text: Section 1708 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking in connection with and all that follows through the period at the end and inserting in accordance with this section;
in subsection (b), by adding at the end the following new paragraphs:
On a space-available basis, a covered beneficiary who must travel a significant distance to receive care or services at a non-Department facility.
On a space-available basis, a member of the family of a covered beneficiary and others who accompany such a covered beneficiary and provide the equivalent of familial support for such beneficiary.
by striking subsection (c) and redesignating subsections (d) and (e) as subsections (c) and (d), respectively;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking subsection (d) and inserting subsection (c);
in paragraph (3), by striking under subsection (b)(2) and inserting or a covered beneficiary under subsection (b);
in paragraph (4), by striking and after the semicolon;
by redesignating paragraph (5) as paragraph (6); and
by inserting after paragraph (4) the following new paragraph (5):

paragraph.text: establishing criteria for providing access to temporary lodging facilities on a space-available basis under subsection (b)(3) and (4); and
by adding at the end the following new subsection:
The term covered beneficiary has the meaning given such term in section 1072(5) of title 10.
The term Fisher house means a housing facility that—

subparagraph.text: is located at, or in proximity to, a Department medical facility;
is available for residential use on a temporary basis by patients of that facility and others described in subsection (b); and
is constructed by, and donated to the Secretary by, the Zachary and Elizabeth M. Fisher Armed Services Foundation or the Fisher House Foundation, Inc.
